isis.stitle: HOOD, GRILLE, FENDERS AND BUMPER - 7000 - REMOVE AND INSTALL - GRILLE

svcsubproc.title: Grille - Removal
svcsubproc.para: The grille is available in two applications; a one piece chrome injection molded assembly, or a fixed grille insert with the shroud tilting with the hood assembly. Both are designed with an aerodynamic styling to enhance the overall appearance of the 7000 series truck chassis.

step1.para: Locate the four lower grille and shroud mounting screws on the grille assembly ( Figure 35, Item 7).
To remove the grille assembly, lift the grille and shroud assembly up and out to release the insert tabs from the grille mounting tab inserts ( Figure 35, Item 9).

svcsubproc.title: Grille - Install
svcsubproc.para: Prior to installing the grille and shroud assembly, inspect the mounting tabs on the inner upper surface of the shroud. Insure that all tabs are functional and in place.

step1.para: Align the mounting tabs with the tab insert slots.
Set the grille/shroud mounting tabs in the insert slots ( Figure 35, Item 9) and tilt grille inward and down to locate the lower screw mounting holes.
Insure the alignment of the screw mounting holes, insert the four mounting screws in the assembly and tighten to 3 to 3.3 lbf-ft (4 to 4.5 Nm).

important.para: Do not overtighten the mounting screws.

svcsubproc.title: Fixed Grille-Remove
svcsubproc.para: The fixed grille application is designed for hood tilting without the grille insert tilting. The grille shroud is a separate component attached to the hood which tilts with the hood. The grille insert remains in the vertical position and is mounted to brackets attached to the radiator frame. This design enables hood tilting without interference with extended bumpers that may have after market applications that would interfere with the grille insert when tilting the hood.

step1.para: Locate and remove upper and lower fixed grille mounting bolts.
If required, remove grille mounting brackets on radiator ( Figure 36, Items 2 and 4). Hood assembly needs to be tilted to remove upper radiator mounting brackets.
If grille mounting brackets need to be installed, tilt hood.
Locate mounting holes on radiator frame and align grille mounting brackets, insert six hex-flanged class 8.8 bolts and torque to 8 to 10 lbf-ft (11 to 13.6 Nm).
Place grille over mounting brackets and align four mounting holes.
Insert the 4 hex-flanged class 10.9 bolts and hand tighten.
Check alignment of grille assembly and torque to 8 to 10 lbf-ft (11 to 13.6 Nm).
Replace shroud assembly, fasten as required, and lower hood.
